com.jms

Class Editor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jms.Editor

  • public class Editor
extends java.lang.Object
    Wraps logic of music file editing

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Editor()
      Default constructor, creates instance of Converter

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeVolume(double gainFactor)
      This function goes through all samples of the .WAV song and multiplies the values by the given gainFactor in order to achieve the volume changing

      This function converts .mp3 song to .WAV song

      Converts WAV file to MP3

    • Method Detail

      • convertMP3ToWav

        public void convertMP3ToWav(java.lang.String filepathToConvert,
                            java.lang.String convertedFilepath)
        This function converts .mp3 song to .WAV song
        Parameters:
        filepathToConvert - - the source file path (mp3)
        convertedFilepath - - the destination file path (wave)

      • loadSong

        public void loadSong(java.io.File fileToOpen)
        This function loads the .WAV song which is to be edited into the RAM memory
        Parameters:
        fileToOpen - - the file to be edited.

      • saveSong

        public void saveSong(java.lang.String filePath)
        This function saves on the hard disk the edited .WAV
        Parameters:
        filePath - - the path to the directory, where the song is to be saved and the song name

      • saveSong

        public void saveSong(java.lang.String filePath,
                     byte[] wavSong)
        This function saves given array with WAV song to the file with given filepathh
        Parameters:
        filePath - - the path to the file where the song is to be saved
        wavSong - - the array containing song raw data

      • muteSong

        public void muteSong(int startSecond,
                     int endSecond)
        This function is responsible for muting the fragment of the currently edited .WAV song.
        Parameters:
        startSecond - - the start time from which the song is cutted
        endSecond - - the end time to which the song is cutted

      • cutSong

        public byte[] cutSong(int startSecond,
                      int endSecond)
        This function cuts the fragment of song, and puts it in another byte array. It assigns also the header of the edited song to the cut fragment
        Parameters:
        startSecond - - the start second to cut
        endSecond - - the end second to cut
        Returns:
        reference to the array with cut fragment.

      • changeVolume

        public void changeVolume(double gainFactor)
        This function goes through all samples of the .WAV song and multiplies the values by the given gainFactor in order to achieve the volume changing
        Parameters:
        gainFactor - - the value which is multiplied with the sample value to get new sample value

      • getWavTagReader

        public com.jms.WavTagReader getWavTagReader()
        Returns reference to WavTagReader instance
        Returns:
        WavTagReader instance

      • convertWavToMP3

        public void convertWavToMP3(java.lang.String filePath)
        Converts WAV file to MP3
        Parameters:
        filePath - path on which MP3 file will be saved
